item.title: Progress Report #24: Atmos Sim Remake Now Simulates Atmos
Progress Report #23: We Didn't Want To Wait Until Atmos Was Done
item.description: Sadly atmos is not done yet. A lot of other stuff is though!

item.title: Progress Report #22: Full Steam Ahead
item.description: It has been 3 months since the last post, we have a lot to tell you!

item.title: Progress Report #21: Colonial Marines, lighting, features
item.description: We have big news for everyone who enjoys slaying meat sacks as a xenomorph, futilely hiding in a locker as a survivor, or being eaten alive as a marine…

item.title: Progress Report #20: 2020 Resolution Failed
item.description: Writing progress reports is hard. Usually it isn’t even writing the progress report itself, it’s making the content we’ve added presentable.

item.title: Progress Report #19: 2x The Wait, 4x The Content
item.description: Kept you waiting, huh?

item.title: Progress Report #18: Speech Bubbles & Slightly Better Launcher
item.description: Writing these into sections is hard, did you know that?

item.title: Progress Report #17: Main UI Plans
item.description: One of the biggest things that scare people away from SS13 is, of course, the terrible user interface. So, let’s make sure that isn’t the case for SS14!

item.title: Progress Report #16: Outline, Use, Kaboom
item.description: As it turns out, re-imagining SS13 is a bit harder than simply re-making it. Not that that deters us.

item.title: Progress Report #15: Bye Godot
item.description: Godot is finally dead, but it will always be there in our hearts.

item.title: Progress Report #14: Content & More Server
item.description: This time on SS14: neat features and neat server features.

item.title: Progress Report #13: Permanent Public Server.
item.description: Working on a massive project like this can be quite daunting. “Remake SS13” is quite a clear goal but far from concrete. Having intermediate goals to work towards is important. So for now, my goal at least is to get a permanent public server running.

item.title: Progress Report #12: Suddenly, Progress!
item.description: Didn’t think you’d already see a new progress report now, did you? And especially not such a packed one!

item.title: Progress Report #11: UI & Animations
item.description: The GUI system is much more complete now, so most interfaces work now. I also decided to actually code something NEW instead of purely catching up to Godot.

item.title: Progress Report #10: Nothing To Say For Ourselves
item.description: Yeah I honestly have nothing to say for myself. You have the right to laugh.

item.title: Progress Report #9: The One Where We Implemented New Features
item.description: Yeah, we really don’t have anything to say here, outside of “look at all these features!”

item.title: Progress Report #8: Writing Some Content
item.description: It’s pretty nice to get to a point where we can worry purely about content without having to juggle the engine around all the time. I think we’re getting close to the point of reaching that now.

item.title: Progress Report #7: Visual
item.description: Fancy graphics and less fancy menus.

item.title: Progress Report #6: Never say 'few'
item.description: The wait is over.

item.title: Progress Report #5: Waiting for Godot
item.description:
So when was the last progress report made? November right?

Oh jeez.

item.title: Nightly Builds Up (Properly!)
item.description: Get your Windows, MacOS and Linux builds here!

item.title: Nightly Builds Up!
item.description: Nightly Windows & Linux builds here!

item.title: Progress Report #4: Robust Content Framework
item.description: It’s been a couple weeks since the last progress report, and lots has happened since then. Refactors, setting up the content repo, and more!

item.title: Progress Report #3: Ending the pre-alpha
item.description: So stuff’s been quiet for the past 14 days. I can give you an annoying excuse or I can just accept that weekly progress reports aren’t working yet. As such progress reports will no longer be scheduled and done whenever we feel there’s something big to report, like today!

item.title: Progress report #2: Refactor Hell
item.description: The progress report took a bit to get here, because I uploaded #1 two days too late, and not a lot of substance for a report happened between then and when #2 should’ve happened. Not the case anymore though, got plenty to write about this time!

item.title: Progress Report #1: Revive
item.description: You’re reading this on the new website for SS14! After lots of hard work with CSS, the website is ready to recieve progress reports and other news.
